Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Initial Appearance as to Luis E. Acevedo-Oquendo (10), Juan David Marin-Martinez (20), Jose Baez-Leon (22), Fernando Suarez-Lafontaine (24), Joan Serrano-Rodriguez (26) and Jose Medina-Grau (28) was held on 3/15/2012. Defts were interviewed by PTS, given copy of the indictment and advised of the charges and as to their rights. CJA counsel shall be appointed for each deft. Govt's motion to unseal the case, as to all defts, was granted. Arraignment/Detention Hearing is set for 3/20/2012 at 9:30 AM in Courtroom 9 before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin. At the govt's request, defts shall remain temporarily detained pending detention hearing. (AUSA Teresa Zapata, AUSA Olga Castellon, PO Carmen Perez, Interpreter Janis Palma) (mc) (Entered: 03/19/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment/Detention Hearing as to Luis E. Acevedo-Oquendo (10) was held on

20/2012. Present: AUSA Olga Castellon, AUSA Teresa Zapata, Attorney Anita Hill, PO Carmen Perez, Interpreter Marie Hernandez and Defendant. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all applicable counts. The government has 5 days to produce discovery. Defendant has 10 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Carmen Cerezo for trial setting. As to bail, Defense counsel had no evidence to rebut the presumptions, but reserved the right to reopen the hearing. (Court Reporter FTR.) (Hearing was set for 9:30 a.m., held at 9:44-10:04 a.m.) (mc) Modified on 3/30/2012 to add name of defense counsel (ni). (Entered: 03/27/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment/Detention Hearing as to Juan David Marin-Martinez (20) was held on 3/20/2012. Present: AUSA Olga Castellon, AUSA Teresa Zapata, Atty Ernesto Hernandez-Milan, PO Carmen Perez, Interpreter Marie Hernandez and Defendant. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all applicable counts. Case is referred to Judge Carmen Cerezo for trial setting. Government requested detention. Defense counsel argued in favor of bail. After hearing the arguments of the parties, the Court imposed bail in the amount of $10,00 of which $5,000 to be secured by cash or real property and $5,000 to be unsecured. Standard conditions of release as recommended by PTS. Deft shall not reside or visit, for any reason, the La Montana Housing Project. Defendant has 7 calendar days to post. (Court Reporter FTR.) (Hearing was set for 9:30 a.m., held at 9:48-10:04 a.m.) (mc) Modified on 3/29/2012 to add docket text (ni). Modified on 12/6/2013 to add name of defense counsel (ni). (Entered: 03/28/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Change of Plea Hearing as to Jonathan Gonzalez-Medina held on 5/1/2013. Present were AUSA Teresa Zapata and Mr. Joseph Boucher. Dft is present and under custody. Waiver of JT and consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. The defendant is found competent to plea. The defendant is advised of the maximum penalties he is facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving said rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to Judge Cerezo so that the guilty plea as to count 1 of the Superseding Indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Sentencing Hearing to be set by Judge Cerezo. Defendant to remain under custody. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Bond Revocation Hearing as to Jonathan Rivera-Medina was held on 9/11/2013. Present: AUSA Teresa Zapata & Atty Joseph Laws. The govt moved for the revocation of bail. Defense counsel was heard as to bail. The conditions of release are modified as follows: home detention with electronic monitoring, PTS shall attempt to qualify deft's brother-in-law as a third party custodian. Deft shall not reside at or visit, for any reason, the La Montane Public Housing Project. All other conditions shall remain the same. Deft shall not be released until PTS has verified that a landline telephone is installed in deft's residence, his brother-in-law has been qualified as a third party custodian and deft has identified a suitable residence. (Court Reporter FTR) (Hearing was set for 1:30 p.m., held at 2:06-2:13 p.m.) (mc) (Entered: 09/16/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo: Case as to Wilfredo Rodriguez-Rivera (18) called for sentence on 4/24/2014. Present were AUSA Teresa S. Zapata- Valladares, and for the defendant Robert Millan. The defendant was present under the custody of the U.S. Marshals, and was assisted by the official court interpreter. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Evidentiary Hearing as to Carlos A. De Jesus-Cuevas (15) held on 9/8/2014. AUSA Teresa Zapata and defense counsel Carlos Beck were present. Defendant was present and under custody. Defendant was heard as to his legal representation and requested that new attorney be appointed. Defense counsel agreed with his client, although efforts were made to meet with defendant. The Government informed that only three defendants are pending for trial, all discovery has been tendered and has no objection that new counsel be appointed. After listening to the parties, the Court granted the withdrawal of counsel Beck. Upon review of the list of CJA attorneys, the Court ordered the direct appointment of CJA counsel Jose Aguayo, who is familiar with the case and has no conflict of interest. Counsel Beck will turn over all discovery to counsel Aguayo. The Government has no objection to extend the plea offer which is to plea to Count | which is the conspiracy count. However, will first need to verify with her superiors if the offer will remain. (Court Reporter FTT/bg.) Hearing set for 01:30. Hearing held at 02:55. Hearing ended at 03:11. Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. (br) (Entered: 09/17/2014)

Minute entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Change of Plea Hearing as to Carlos A. De Jesus-Cuevas (15) held on 12/10/2014. Present: AUSA Teresa Zapata and Defense Counsel Jose R. Aguayo. Defendant is present and under custody. Consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. The defendant is found competent to plea. Defendant is advised of the maximum penalties he faces, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving his rights and applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to Carmen C. Cerezo, U.S. District Judge, so that the guilty plea as to count 1 of the Superseding Indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Defendant will remain detained. Counsel informs the Court MDC has approved a clinical procedure for defendant and request he not be taken to Atlanta so the procedure can take place. The Court instructs Counsel Aguayo to file a motion on the matter before the presiding judge. Sentencing Hearing set for 3/12/2015 04:30 PM in Courtroom 4 before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo. (Court Reporter FTR.) (Court Interpreter Felix Toledo.) Hearing set for 11:00. Hearing held at 10:56. Hearing ended at 11:18. (msc) (Entered: 12/10/2014)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan: Status Conference as to Michelle Rodriguez-Rivera (31) held on 12/4/2018. Present were AUSA Teresa Zapata and AFPD Victor Gonzalez. The Court inquired from the parties as to the status of the defendant's psychiatric evaluation and treatment. AUSA Zapata informed the Court that the defendant at this moment was unstable and that BOP required additional time to treat her. Defense counsel agreed with the Government and stated that it was in the defendant's best interest to continue receiving treatment so she may be restored and participate meaningfully in the hearing. Parties requested a continuance of the hearing. After having heard the parties, the Court grated the request. A hearing will be held to determine her competency. Competency Hearing is set for 1/11/2019 at 9:30 AM in Available Courtroom before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan. (Court Reporter DCR. Courtroom # 1) Hearing set for 9:30 am. Hearing held at 10:08 am. Hearing ended at 10:22 am. Interpreter Hilda Gutierrez. (cmd) (Entered: 12/07/2018)

Defendant voluntarily consented to the holding of the hearing via VTC. Defendant was advised of the alleged SRT violations filed at ECF No. 1987 and his right to a preliminary hearing to determine whether his supervised release conditions have been violated. The Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. The FPD was appointed to represent the defendant. Defendant was ordered temporarily detained. A Preliminary Revocation Hearing is set for 6/25/2021 at 09:30 am via VTC before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. If the government intends to call a witness that is not fluent in the English language, failure of the government to timely retain the services of an interpreter may result in the imposition of sanctions. Pursuant to the Due Process Protections Act, Pub. L. No. 116-182, 134 Stat. 894 (Oct. 21, 2020) and Rule 5(f) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure, the United States is reminded of its obligation to disclose in a timely manner all exculpatory evidence to the defendant[s], that is, all evidence that is favorable to the defendant|s] or tends to cast doubt on the United States case, as required by Brady v. Maryland, 373 U.S. 83 (1963) and its progeny. Failure to comply with this order may result in consequences, including, but not limited to, the exclusion of evidence, dismissal of the revocation proceedings regarding the alleged supervised release violations, contempt proceedings, disciplinary action, and/or sanctions by the Court. Miuinute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Sigfredo De Jesus-Rodriguez (37) held on 6/25/2021. AUSA Juan Reyes, AFPD Jesus Hernandez and USPO Linda Perez were present. Defendant was under custody, present and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. Defendant voluntarily waived his right to be physically present at the courthouse and consented to proceed via VTC. Furthermore, defendant verbally waived his right to the preliminary revocation hearing. The Court accepted the waiver and found probable cause pursuant to the violations contained in the motion filed at ECF No. 1987 and 2009 . The case was referred to Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi for the scheduling of a final revocation hearing. Defense counsel argued for conditions of release. The government expressed its concerns. Statements from the USPO were heard. The Court modified defendant's conditions of supervised release by adding that defendant shall participate in an intensive outpatient substance abuse  program. Under these circumstances, the Court granted conditions of release. (Court Reporter Zoom.) Hearing set for 09:30. Hearing held at 09:33. Hearing ended at 09:50. Interpreter Olga Uribe.
